channel.title: Space Station News
channel.description: A RSS news feed containing the latest NASA press releases on the International Space Station.

item.title: Maryland, Michigan, Texas Students to Link Up with NASA Astronauts on Space Station
item.description: Students from Maryland, Michigan and Texas will talk with astronauts on the International Space Station this week as part of NASA’s Year of Education on Station.

item.title: Frostburg State Students to Speak with NASA Astronaut in Space
item.description: Frostburg State University, in collaboration with its sister institutions in Frostburg, Maryland, will speak with NASA astronaut Ricky Arnold who is living, working and doing research aboard the International Space Station at 9:55 a.m. EDT Monday, April 9.

item.title: New Research Heading to Space Station Aboard 14th SpaceX Resupply Mission
item.description: Astronauts aboard the International Space Station soon will receive a delivery of experiments dealing with how the human body, plants and materials behave in space following the 4:30 p.m. EDT launch Monday of a SpaceX commercial resupply mission.

item.title: NASA Television to Air Launch of Next Space Station Resupply Mission
item.description: NASA commercial cargo provider SpaceX now is targeting its 14th resupply mission to the International Space Station for no earlier than 4:30 p.m. EDT Monday, April 2.

item.title: Two NASA Astronauts Among Crew Heading to International Space Station
item.description: Three crew members, including NASA astronauts Drew Feustel and Ricky Arnold, are on their way to the International Space Station after launching from the Baikonur Cosmodrome in Kazakhstan at 1:44 p.m. EDT Wednesday (11:44 p.m. Baikonur time).

item.title: NASA to Preview Upcoming US Spacewalk, Provide Live Coverage
item.description: Two American astronauts will venture outside the International Space Station on Thursday, March 29, for a planned 6.5-hour spacewalk. Experts from NASA will preview this work in a briefing at 2 p.m. EDT Tuesday, March 27, at NASA’s Johnson Space Center in Houston.

item.title: NASA to Highlight Science Launching on Next Resupply Mission to Space Station
item.description: NASA will host a media teleconference at 11 a.m. EDT Monday, March 19, to discuss a number of science investigations and instruments launching in April to the International Space Station on the next SpaceX commercial resupply mission. Audio of the teleconference will stream live on NASA’s website.

item.title: NASA Television Coverage Set for Space Station Crew Launch, Docking
item.description: Two American astronauts and a Russian cosmonaut are ready for their journey to the International Space Station that begins on Wednesday, March 21.

item.title: Science Teachers at National Conference to Speak with NASA Astronaut on Space Station
item.description: The National Science Teachers Association (NSTA) Conference in Atlanta will speak with NASA astronaut Scott Tingle, currently living and working aboard the International Space Station, at 10:40 a.m. EDT Friday, March 16.

item.title: Massachusetts Students to Speak with NASA Astronaut on Space Station
item.description: Students from the University of Massachusetts Dartmouth (UMass Dartmouth,) will speak with NASA astronaut and alumnus Scott Tingle, who is living and working aboard the International Space Station, at 12:30 p.m. EST Tuesday, March 6. The 20 minute, Earth-to-space call will air live on NASA Television and the agency’s website.
